dcterms:creator: Cinjon Resnick
Wes Eldridge
David Ha
Denny Britz
Jakob N. Foerster
Julian Togelius
Kyunghyun Cho
Joan Bruna
dcterms:description: Pommerman is a multi-agent environment inspired by the video game series Bomberman, where up to four bomber agents move across a discrete grid-world and try to defeat their opponents by placing bombs.
dcterms:title: Pommerman

dcterms:creator: Jannis Weil
Adrian Alic
dcterms:description: SimpleCpp agent data consists of samples generated by SimpleCpp agents playing FFA games with random start conditions for up to 800 steps.
dcterms:title: SimpleCpp agent data

dcterms:description: RawNet opponent models are used as a more sophisticated opponent model for evaluating agent performance.
dcterms:title: RawNet opponent models

dcterms:description: Expert demonstrations consist of data collected from expert agents playing the game, used for training models.
dcterms:title: Expert demonstrations

dcterms:description: Samples generated by search approaches are used to train models in a reinforcement learning setting.
dcterms:title: Samples generated by search approaches

dcterms:description: SimpleAgent data refers to the baseline agent data provided in the Pommerman environment.
dcterms:title: SimpleAgent data

dcterms:description: SimpleUnbiasedAgent data is an improved version of the SimpleAgent that reduces decision bias.
dcterms:title: SimpleUnbiasedAgent data
